    • Method Detail

      • findAnnotations

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               readOnly=true)
public <T extends TimedAnnotatableBE> Set<AnnotationInstance> findAnnotations(T entity)
        Retrieves all annotations for the given entity. This is a convenience method. It actually just retrieves annotations from the entity object, but it performs additional null checks on the annotation aggregate.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to retrieve the annotations for
        Returns:
        a set of AnnotationInstances for the given entity

      • findAnnotations

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               readOnly=true)
public <T extends TypedTimedAnnotatableBE> Set<AnnotationInstance> findAnnotations(T entity)
        Retrieves all annotations for the given entity. This is a convenience method. It actually just retrieves annotations from the entity object, but it performs additional null checks on the annotation aggregate.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to retrieve the annotations for
        Returns:
        a set of AnnotationInstances for the given entity

      • createTypedAnnotation

        public AnnotationInstance createTypedAnnotation(String type)
        Creates a new AnnotationInstance and associates it with an AnnotationType that matches the provided String. If an annotationtype with the provided String already exists, it will be reused.
        Parameters:
        type - the value for the AnnotationType
        Returns:
        a new empty AnnotationInstance that is already saved to the db and connected with its requested type

      • createFeature

        public Feature createFeature(String value)
        Creates a new Feature with the provided value. No type is assigned.
        Parameters:
        value - the feature value
        Returns:
        a new empty Feature that is already saved to the db and connected with its requested type

      • createTypedFeature

        public Feature createTypedFeature(String value,
                                  String type)
        Creates a new Feature and associates it with a FeatureType that matches the provided String. If an FeatureType with the provided String already exists, it will be reused.
        Parameters:
        value - the feature value
        type - the value for the FeatureType
        Returns:
        a new empty Feature that is already saved to the db and connected with its requested type

      • createTypedFeature

        public Feature createTypedFeature(String type)
        Creates a new Feature and associates it with a FeatureType that matches the provided String. If an FeatureType with the provided String already exists, it will be reused.
        Parameters:
        type - the value for the FeatureType
        Returns:
        a new empty Feature that is already saved to the db and connected with its requested type

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to add a new source to
        annotation - the annotation instance to add to the entity
